articles.author: Rohan Nilatkar
articles.description:
ğŸ•¯ï¸ A Tribute to the AIâ€‘171 Crash Victims â€” Built with Just HTML & CSS


On June 12, 2025, Air India Flight AIâ€‘171 tragically crashed in Ahmedabad.

Out of 270 people on board, only one person survived.
Like many others, I was deeply affected by the news.

As a frontend development student, I decided to use my skills to pay tribute â€” in the simplest but most heartfelt way I could.
â®•ğŸ”— Live Demo: [Visit the tribute site (https://preyliet.github.io/ai171-tribute/)
â®•ğŸ§¾ Source Code: GitHub Repository
â®• âš ï¸ This site contains no images of the crash only soft, respectful design and text.*
âœ… HTML for structure

ğŸ¨ CSS for design and responsiveness

â˜ï¸ GitHub Pages to host it for free



No JavaScript. No frameworks.

Just clean code and emotion.
I asked myself:
How can I design something respectful with no distractions?
How can HTML & CSS alone carry the weight of emotion?
What kind of layout calms the eyes, yet delivers a message?
I kept the colours subtle, the layout clean, and the typography soft.

Thereâ€™s no noise â€” only tribute.

This was a personal, emotional project but I'm also looking to grow as a developer.
ğŸ™ I would love to hear your feedback:
What did you feel while visiting the site?
Any design tips youâ€™d suggest?
Do you think devs should do more human-cantered projects like this?
Sometimes, we code to solve problems.

Other times, we code to honour people, tell stories, and offer a moment of silence in a digital world.
Thank you for reading. If this touched you even a little, please leave a comment or share.
ğŸ’¬ Connect with me on X (Twitter)  I'm always open to thoughts, suggestions, and conversations.
articles.title: ğŸ•¯ï¸ A Tribute to the AIâ€‘171 Crash Victims Built with Just HTML & CSS

articles.author: Shruti Saraswat
articles.description:
In 2025, with document translation tools evolving rapidly, the debate has sharpenedâ€”are AI translation systems finally better than human experts when it comes to translating technical documents?
If youâ€™ve ever dealt with technical documentation translationâ€”be it user manuals, legal disclaimers, engineering guides, or medical instructionsâ€”you know how high the stakes are. One mistranslated term in a user safety guide or software specification can lead to real-world confusion or compliance issues.
In this post, weâ€™ll explore:
    The core differences between human and AI translation in high-stakes documents
    When AI outperforms humans (and when it doesn't)
    How hybrid translation workflows are becoming the norm
    Which tools are leading the race in technical translation automation
  â€¦
articles.title: AI vs Human: Which Is Better for Translating Technical Documents?

articles.author: Om Shree
articles.description:
Hello coders! ğŸ”§
Today, letâ€™s tackle a beautiful binary search + greedy problem from LeetCode â€” 2616: Minimize the Maximum Difference of Pairs. It's one of those problems that seems hard at first glance but becomes elegant with the right strategy.
Letâ€™s decode it together. ğŸ§©
Given:
An integer array nums

An integer p (number of index pairs to form)
Objective:
p disjoint pairs (no overlapping indices) such that the maximum absolute difference across all selected pairs is minimized.
Input:
nums = [10,1,2,7,1,3], p = 2
Output: 1
Explanation:
(1,4) and (2,5):
|1 - 1| = 0, |2 - 3| = 1 â†’ Max = 1 (minimum possible maximum).
This is a "minimize the maximum" problem â€” a perfect use case for binary search on the answer.
Sort the array to allow greedy pairing.
Use binary search to test if a given maâ€¦
articles.title: ğŸ”§ Beginner-Friendly Guide "Minimize the Maximum Difference of Pairs" LeetCode 2616 (C++ | JavaScript | Python)

articles.author: Kye Stuart
articles.description:
When building .NET applications that require PDF generation, developers often face the decision between using open-source tools like DinkToPdf or commercial libraries such as IronPDF. While both can convert HTML to PDF, they differ significantly in capabilities, support, performance, and ease of use. Choosing the appropriate library for your needs can be difficult, this article provides a clear, side-by-side comparison to help .NET developers choose the right library for their project.

DinkToPdf is a .NET Core wrapper for the popular open-source wkhtmltopdf library. It allows you to convert HTML documents into PDFs using WebKit-based rendering. While it's free to use, it has limitations, especially around modern HTML/CSS rendering and error handling. It also requires native binaries and câ€¦
articles.title: DinkToPdf Alternatives: IronPDF for C# HTML to PDF

articles.author: Ranjani R
articles.description:
Today I learnt about lists in HTML which are very useful when we need to group certain data or highlight certain points in an website. There are mainly three types of list Ordered Unordered and Description.
Ordered List
Numbers are used by default as markers for each list item. We can also use Alphabets(Capital and Small) and Roman Numerals as markers by setting the type attribute of list tag.
Unordered List
Bullets are used as markers. We can change that to Circle or Square using the list-style-type attribute.
Description List
  This list is mainly used to provide important details regarding a topic in a short format. It is like a nested list in which content is nested inside a heading. No markers are used for this type of list.
articles.title: DAY 5
